overview: The Committee on Higher Education finds that establishing a single conference center revolving fund within the University of Hawaii System would standardize implementation of conference center programs across the various campuses of the University of Hawaii System. [4] This would thereby increase access to conference center usage on University of Hawaii campuses. [4] The University of Hawai‘i (UH) supports HB 1169, which establishes the University of Hawai‘i Conference Center Revolving Fund and accounts under the fund to facilitate its administration for conference center programs. [2]
assumptions_and_methodology: The measure was amended to clarify that all unencumbered funds in the existing Conference Center Revolving Funds for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community Colleges will lapse to the new University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund on the effective date. [4] The effective date was changed to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [4]
economic_impact: Your Committee finds that establishing a single conference center revolving fund within the University of Hawaii System would standardize implementation of conference center programs across the various campuses of the University of Hawaii System, thereby increasing access to conference center usage on University of Hawaii campuses. [4]
policy_impact: The measure has been amended by changing the effective date to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [4] It was also amended to clarify that all unencumbered funds in the repealed funds shall lapse to the new fund. [4] Technical, nonsubstantive amendments were also made for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. [4]
revenue_sources: On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund, university of Hawaii at Hilo; and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund established pursuant to section 1 of this Act. [3] [3]
six_year_fiscal_implications: This Act shall take effect on July 1, 3000. [3] The effective date was changed to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [4] Consequently, there are no fiscal implications for this measure within the six-year planning period. [3] [4] The transfer of all unencumbered funds from the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo, and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund will occur on the effective date of the measure. [4]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The fiscal implications detailed in this measure will take effect on July 1, 3000. [3]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The most significant change from the prior version of the bill is the amended effective date, which has been changed to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [4] The measure was also amended to clarify that all unencumbered funds, rather than all appropriations and encumbrances, from the repealed revolving funds shall lapse to the new fund. [4] Additionally, committee testimony and findings now state that a single fund would standardize implementation of conference center programs and increase access to their usage across University of Hawaii campuses. [4]
